Name: Mohammed Shami
Teams: Kolkata Knight Riders, India A, Bengal, India, Rest of India, Board Presidents XI, East Zone, Indians, Delhi Capitals, Mohun Bagan, World XI, Punjab Kings, Asia XI
Bio: Mohammed Shami was India's leading fast bowler in the 2015 World Cup in Australia,when the team marched into the semi-finals  picked up 77 out of 80 wickets on offer,It was later revealed that he had played through that entire tournament -  the preceding Test series against the hosts,essentially four months - through a knee injury,His success can be attributed to his pace,accuracy  primarily his skill in moving the ball - both old  new,There were plenty of frustrating times as well,Shami was hopeful of a return to the Indian team in early 2016,but a hamstring injury ruled him out a limited-overs tour of Australia  the Asia Cup in February,He was selected in a 15-man squad for the World T20 in March,but was unable to break into the XI having spent a year out of international cricket
